intro: Trochocarpa parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered trochocarpa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
